terms.definition: Quality Assurance - the systematic process of ensuring that products or services meet specified requirements and standards
A software service that runs on remote servers accessed via the internet, rather than being installed locally on individual computers
A single, unified location where all documents, files, and data are stored and managed for easy access and organization
The ability for multiple users to work on the same document or project simultaneously with instant updates visible to all participants
Pre-designed document formats that provide a standardized structure and layout for creating consistent documentation
Enterprise Resource Planning - integrated software systems that manage and automate core business processes across an organization
The state of having all necessary documentation and processes properly organized and accessible for regulatory or compliance inspections
Documentation that demonstrates adherence to regulatory requirements, industry standards, and legal obligations
A software system designed specifically for creating, managing, organizing, and sharing various types of documents and content
A software system that can easily adapt and expand to handle increased workload, users, or data without performance degradation
The process of connecting different software systems or tools to work together seamlessly and share data automatically
The process of converting physical documents or analog information into digital format for electronic storage and management
A defined sequence of tasks, processes, or steps that are followed to complete a specific business operation or project
Standardized lists of items, criteria, or procedures that must be verified or completed during quality control evaluations
Formal documents that demonstrate an organization's adherence to regulatory requirements, standards, and legal obligations
